message_1: What is the final product formed when aqueous solutions of potassium iodide and lead (II) nitrate are combined? Write a balanced chemical equation for the reaction and state whether it is a double replacement reaction or not.
message_2:
When aqueous solutions of potassium iodide (KI) and lead (II) nitrate (Pb(NO3)2) are combined, a double replacement reaction occurs. The final products formed are lead (II) iodide (PbI2) and potassium nitrate (KNO3).

The balanced chemical equation for the reaction is:

2 KI (aq) + Pb(NO3)2 (aq) â†’ 2 KNO3 (aq) + PbI2 (s)

Lead (II) iodide (PbI2) is a solid precipitate, while potassium nitrate (KNO3) remains in the aqueous solution.
